column4: okay, who knows how to fix samba sharing in 8.04 so it works with windows puters correctly?
no knowledge, but i recall that you have to change some registery key in windows for it
but how come it worked "out of the box" in 7.10 then?
hmm.. then there is probably some options to turn to get it work, that registery fix thing is few years old info
does it give any error or ...?
in ubuntu, I simply can't list the contents of windows shares
but no problems to log in ?
you 100% that  logged in samba user has rights to read directory
doesn't even ask for a login... that's probably one of the problems
I'm not logged in, but the user should have access, it works from other win 'puter
force it to use your ubuntu username
in windows, map networks drive and there is option to select username and password
how do you do it on a shared folder?
umm... cant remember, havent used windows for year.
but from filebrowser tools -> map networkd drive -> there should be a button to select login name
